bibl.title: A New Testament Papyrus and Its Documentary Context: An Early Christian Writing Exercise from the Archive of Leonides (P. Oxy. II 209 / p10).
bibl.note: Parts of this paper were presented at the 25th International Congress of Papyrology (Ann Arbor, July 2007) and at the conference "Lire les papyrus du Nouveau Testament avec les autres papyrus d'Égypte" (Lausanne, October 2009). - I. The Papyrus [P. Oxy. II, 209 (= van Haelst 490; LDAB 3025)] and Its Texts. - II. Identifying the Archive. - III. A New Testament Papyrus from a Documentary Archive. - IV. Leonides, Son of Theon: Merchant and Member of a Professional Association. - V. Leonides and His Network. - VI. Amulet, Pious Penmanship, or School Exercise? - VII. Conclusion. - Pp. 594-596: Appendix: The Archive of Aurelius Leonides, Son of Theon.
bibl.seg: LUIJENDIJK AnneMarie, A New Testament Papyrus and Its Documentary Context: An Early Christian Writing Exercise from the Archive of Leonides (P. Oxy. II 209 / p10).

Parts of this paper were presented at the 25th International Congress of Papyrology (Ann Arbor, July 2007) and at the conference "Lire les papyrus du Nouveau Testament avec les autres papyrus d'Égypte" (Lausanne, October 2009). - I. The Papyrus [P. Oxy. II, 209 (= van Haelst 490; LDAB 3025)] and Its Texts. - II. Identifying the Archive. - III. A New Testament Papyrus from a Documentary Archive. - IV. Leonides, Son of Theon: Merchant and Member of a Professional Association. - V. Leonides and His Network. - VI. Amulet, Pious Penmanship, or School Exercise? - VII. Conclusion. - Pp. 594-596: Appendix: The Archive of Aurelius Leonides, Son of Theon.
